{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3535681,"name":"UnofficialForth","username":"UnofficialForth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unofficialforth/{size}/167902_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-21T20:13:35.444Z","cooked":"

For WPILib devs: what is the preferred way to ask for documentation that is confusing to be changed? An issue on github?

The situation:
While using Rotation2d, we discovered that there appeared to be wrapping that was occurring. Yet, in two places in the documentation, it says that Rotation2d does not wrap the angle:

image852×135 8.57 KB

image1186×187 8.79 KB

We disregarded this as the problem, only later today to find out the following:

image1084×89 7.65 KB

By using the plus() method, it was wrapping the angle, which was counter intuitive to the more visible docs.

I would recommend making an issue on GitHub. One of them has probably seen this by now too.

Issues are good, pull requests are even better

Note that there are multiple methods involved here and they may not all have the same wrapping behavior.

These two PRs might be of interest:

github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib

[wpimath] Put Rotation2d's value always in the -pi to pi scope

wpilibsuite:main ← ohowe1:rotation2d-scope
opened 04:55AM - 11 Nov 22 UTC
ohowe1
+69 -43

The `getRadians` and `getDegrees` will now always return in the -pi to pi or -18…0 to 180 scope.

github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib

Revert Rotation2D change that limits angles

wpilibsuite:main ← Beachbot330:RevertRotation2D
opened 02:50PM - 08 Dec 22 UTC
sciencewhiz
+54 -56

This broke multiple teams code in beta. It is also easier to limit the angle ext…ernally, then reconstruct a larger angle that got limited. This additionally adds comments to clarify the behavior and retains tests that were added in the reverted commit, and fixes a javadoc comment angle reference. Revert "[wpimath] Constrain Rotation2d range to -pi to pi (#4611)" This reverts commit d1d458db2b6c091f8167a15be54c1fa28617d04d

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-21T21:03:23.368Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":130.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492619,"topic_slug":"how-to-ask-wpilib-to-adjust-confusing-documentation","display_username":"UnofficialForth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29982,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-ask-wpilib-to-adjust-confusing-documentation/492619/6","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3535783,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-21T21:49:47.257Z","cooked":"
UnofficialForth:

While using Rotation2d, we discovered that there appeared to be wrapping that was occurring. Yet, in two places in the documentation, it says that Rotation2d does not wrap the angle:

The constructor documentation is correct here. The angle passed to the constructor will not be wrapped (for legacy reasons), so calling getRadians() or getDegrees() will return that value back to you. Doing any operations on the Rotation2d will cause the Euler angle to wrap.

The 2027 version of Rotation2d will wrap the angle passed to it. Rotation2d is not an Euler angle, so if you want an Euler angle, use an Euler angle.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-21T21:50:28.788Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":86.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492619,"topic_slug":"how-to-ask-wpilib-to-adjust-confusing-documentation","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-ask-wpilib-to-adjust-confusing-documentation/492619/7","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537921,"name":"UnofficialForth","username":"UnofficialForth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unofficialforth/{size}/167902_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T14:43:09.211Z","cooked":"

It’s not that the documentation is incorrect, it’s that using “plus” or “minus” wraps the angle before constructing a new Rotation2d. The multiple “warnings” about the constructor not wrapping make it easy to assume that wrapping will never occur with Rotation 2d objects, which isn’t true. I’m pushing for a clarification of the docs, which are technically true, but can be misleading.
